spells.name: Fireball

components.m: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

entries: A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 8d6} Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried start {@hazard burning|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 8d6|3-9|1d6} for each spell slot level above 3.

inventory.name: Orion Chassis
entries: Represents the enchanced AC that Leo & Orion gets when they go into integrated mode.

inventory.name: Book
entries: A Book contains fiction or nonfiction. If you consult an accurate nonfiction Book about its topic, you gain a +5 bonus to Intelligence ({@skill Arcana|XPHB}, {@skill History|XPHB}, {@skill Nature|XPHB}, or {@skill Religion|XPHB}) checks you make about that topic.

inventory.name: Piss Yellow Tower Shield
entries: Provides +3 AC and Half Cover when worn. Made out of wood.
Shields require the Utilize action to Don or Doff. You gain the Armor Class benefit of a Shield only if you have training with it.

inventory.name: Potion of Healing
entries: This potion is a magic item. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can drink it or administer it to another creature within 5 feet of yourself. The creature that drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains {@dice 2d4 + 2} {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

features.name: Innate Sorcery
entries: An event in your past left an indelible mark on you, infusing you with simmering magic. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can unleash that magic for 1 minute, during which you gain the following benefits:

items: The spell save DC of your Sorcerer spells increases by 1.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the attack rolls of Sorcerer spells you cast.

entries: You can use this feature twice, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

features.name: Spellcasting
entries: Drawing from your innate magic, you can cast spells. See {@book chapter 7|XPHB|7} for the rules on spellcasting. The information below details how you use those rules with Sorcerer spells, which appear in the {@filter Sorcerer spell list|spells|class=Sorcerer} later in the class's description.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know four Sorcerer cantrips of your choice. {@spell Light|XPHB}, {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB}, {@spell Shocking Grasp|XPHB}, and {@spell Sorcerous Burst|XPHB} are recommended. Whenever you gain a Sorcerer level, you can replace one of your cantrips from this feature with another Sorcerer cantrip of your choice.
When you reach Sorcerer levels 4 and 10, you learn another Sorcerer cantrip of your choice, as shown in the Cantrips column of the Sorcerer Features table.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Sorcerer Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your level 1+ spells. You regain all expended slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose two level 1 Sorcerer spells. {@spell Burning Hands|XPHB} and {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Sorcerer levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Sorcerer Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional Sorcerer spells until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the Sorcerer Features table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 3 Sorcerer, your list of prepared spells can include six Sorcerer spells of level 1 or 2 in any combination.

If another Sorcerer feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Sorcerer spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you gain a Sorcerer level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Sorcerer spell for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Sorcerer spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item Arcane Focus|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Sorcerer spells.

features.name: Font of Magic
entries: You can tap into the wellspring of magic within yourself. This wellspring is represented by Sorcery Points, which allow you to create a variety of magical effects.

You have 2 Sorcery Points, and you gain more as you reach higher levels, as shown in the Sorcery Points column of the Sorcerer Features table. You can't have more Sorcery Points than the number shown in the table for your level. You regain all expended Sorcery Points when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
You can use your Sorcery Points to fuel the options below, along with other features, such as Metamagic, that use those points.

entries.name: Converting Spell Slots to Sorcery Points
entries: You can expend a spell slot to gain a number of Sorcery Points equal to the slot's level (no action required).

entries.name: Creating Spell Slots
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can transform unexpended Sorcery Points into one spell slot. The Creating Spell Slots table shows the cost of creating a spell slot of a given level, and it lists the minimum Sorcerer level you must be to create a slot. You can create a spell slot no higher than level 5.
Any spell slot you create with this feature vanishes when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

features.name: Metamagic
entries: Because your magic flows from within, you can alter your spells to suit your needs; you gain two Metamagic options of your choice from "{@filter Metamagic Options|optionalfeatures|feature type=MM|source=XPHB}" later in this class's description. You use the chosen options to temporarily modify spells you cast. To use an option, you must spend the number of Sorcery Points that it costs.
You can use only one Metamagic option on a spell when you cast it unless otherwise noted in one of those options.
Whenever you gain a Sorcerer level, you can replace one of your Metamagic options with one you don't know. You gain two more options at Sorcerer level 10 and two more at Sorcerer level 17.

features.name: Metamagic Options

selected.name: Seeking Spell
entries: If you make an attack roll for a spell and miss, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to reroll the {@dice d20}, and you must use the new roll.
You can use Seeking Spell even if you've already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

selected.name: Distant Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has a range of at least 5 feet, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to double the spell's range. Or when you cast a spell that has a range of Touch, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to make the spell's range 30 feet.
The following options are available to your Metamagic feature. The options are presented in alphabetical order.

features.name: Sorcerer Subclass
entries: You gain a Sorcerer subclass of your choice. A subclass is a specialization that grants you features at certain Sorcerer levels. For the rest of your career, you gain each of your subclass's features that are of your Sorcerer level or lower.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Sorcerer levels 8, 12, and 16.

features.name: Sorcerous Restoration
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can regain expended Sorcery Points, but no more than a number equal to half your Sorcerer level (round down). Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

features.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Sorcerer subclass.

features.name: Sorcery Incarnate
entries: If you have no uses of Innate Sorcery left, you can use it if you spend 2 Sorcery Points when you take the {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to activate it.
In addition, while your Innate Sorcery feature is active, you can use up to two of your {@filter Metamagic options|optionalfeatures|feature type=MM} on each spell you cast.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

features.name: Metamagic
entries: Because your magic flows from within you, you can alter your spells to suit your needs; you gain two Metamagic options of your choice from the "{@filter Metamagic Options|optionalfeatures|feature type=MM|source=XPHB}" section later in this class's description.
You can use only one Metamagic option on a spell when you cast it, unless otherwise noted in one of those options.
Whenever you gain a Sorcerer level, you can replace one of your Metamagic options with one you don't know.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

features.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Sorcerer subclass.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

features.name: Metamagic
entries: Because your magic flows from within you, you can alter your spells to suit your needs; you gain two Metamagic options of your choice from the "{@filter Metamagic Options|optionalfeatures|feature type=MM|source=XPHB}" section later in this class's description.
You can use only one Metamagic option on a spell when you cast it, unless otherwise noted in one of those options.
Whenever you gain a Sorcerer level, you can replace one of your Metamagic options with one you don't know.

features.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature from your Sorcerer subclass.

features.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. {@feat Boon of Dimensional Travel|XPHB} is recommended.

features.name: Arcane Apotheosis
entries: While your Innate Sorcery feature is active, you can use one Metamagic option on each of your turns without spending Sorcery Points on it.

notes.title: TO DO LIST:
notes.subject: Typa shi to do for this goofy ahh website
notes.content:
1. Implement the background features for the character. (PARTIALLY DONE)
  2. Implement the race features for the character. (PARTIALLY DONE)
  3. Add advantage/disadvantage button to automate rolls.
  4. Refine optional features choosing and automation. This includes class features, background features, race features, etc. (PARTIALLY DONE; Skilled and Expertise Bullshit left)
  5. Improve UI for vitals section.
  6. Improve UI for character header.
  7. Add ability to edit names of containers.
  8. Refine Spell Section to be more useful
  9. Add spell modifier, attack, save DC in spell section.
  10. Show hit/dc and effect on each spell card
  11. Add homebrew section (PARTIALLY DONE)
  12. Implement class feature for the character.

FINISHED:
  1. Add spell modifier, attack, save DC in spell section. (DONE)
  2. Show hit/dc and effect on each spell card (DONE)

feats.name: Magic Initiate; Wizard
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Cleric|spells|level=0;1|class=Cleric}, {@filter Druid|spells|level=0;1|class=Druid}, or {@filter Wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=Wizard} spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat).

entries.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: Choose a level 1 spell from the same list you selected for this feat's cantrips. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

entries.name: Spell Change
entries: Whenever you gain a new level, you can replace one of the spells you chose for this feat with a different spell of the same level from the chosen spell list.

entries.name: Repeatable
entries: You can take this feat more than once, but you must choose a different spell list each time.

items.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Cleric|spells|level=0;1|class=Cleric} spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat).

items.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: Choose a level 1 spell from the {@filter Cleric|spells|level=0;1|class=Cleric} spell list. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

items.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Druid|spells|level=0;1|class=Druid} spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat).

items.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: Choose a level 1 spell from the {@filter Druid|spells|level=0;1|class=Druid} spell list. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

items.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=Wizard} spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat).

items.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: Choose a level 1 spell from the {@filter Wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=Wizard} spell list. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

items.name: Two Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=Wizard} spell list. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this feat).

items.name: Level 1 Spell
entries: Choose a level 1 spell from the {@filter Wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=Wizard} spell list. You always have that spell prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

feats.name: War Caster
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

entries.name: Reactive Spell
entries: When a creature provokes an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} from you by leaving your reach, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to cast a spell at the creature rather than making an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB}. The spell must have a casting time of one action and must target only that creature.

entries.name: Somatic Components
entries: You can perform the Somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a {@item Shield|XPHB} in one or both hands.

feats.name: Skilled
entries: You gain proficiency in any combination of three {@table Skill List; Skills|XPHB|skills} or {@filter tools|items|type=tool;artisan's tools;instrument;gaming set} of your choice.

entries.name: Repeatable
entries: You can take this feat more than once.

features.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Gemini Protocol lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a spell. The following spells are added to the  spell list for you.

features.name: Protocol Integration
entries: Your patron is the sentient A.I. of a powerful suit of armor you have bonded with. You gain the following features:

items: **Symbiotic Armor:** You gain proficiency with **medium armor**, **smith's tools**, and **tinkers tools**.
**Integrated Armory:** You gain proficiency with all **simple and martial weapons**.

entries.name: Equipment Manifest
entries: Your symbiotic link with Orion allows you to analyze, store, and replicate the forms of mundane equipment, as well as integrate unique magical items into your arsenal.
****Equipment Analysis****

You can spend 1 hour with a non-magical item, allowing Orion to perfectly analyze its structure and composition. The item can be any simple or martial weapon, a suit of armor, a shield, a tool, or any piece of adventuring gear. Once this analysis is complete, Orion permanently stores that item's blueprint in its Known Blueprints.
****Equipment Manifestation****

As a bonus action, you can have Orion manifest a perfect, non-magical copy of any item for which you have a blueprint in your current list of **Stored Blueprints**. This item appears in your empty hand or on the ground in your space. The manifested item has the following properties:

items: The manifested item is sustained by your psychic link to Orion. It disappears if it is ever outside the range of your psychic tether for more than 1 minute, or if you manifest a different item. You can also dismiss the item at any time (no action required).

**Metaphysical Transience:** Manifested items are a temporary projection of matter sustained by the Infernal Core. They register as non-magical but have no monetary value and cannot be sold. They turn to harmless ash if a transaction involving them is completed.

**Replication Protocol:** You can manifest one item as part of this bonus action at no extra cost. You can choose to manifest additional, identical copies of that same item as part of the same bonus action, but you must gain **1 Core Strain** for each additional item you create.
If the manifested item is a weapon, it is considered your pact weapon and uses your Charisma modifier for its attack and damage rolls.
If the manifested weapon has the Ammunition property, it magically produces its own ammunition.

entries: ****Interaction with Magic Items****
You can use your analytical abilities to bond with and store existing magic items.

items: You can perform the 1-hour analysis ritual on a magic item to bond with it. Orion integrates the specific item into its systems.
You can then dismiss the bonded magic item to an extradimensional space and summon it to your empty hand (or have it appear donned on your person, in the case of armor or clothing) as a bonus action.
**Crucially, Orion cannot create magical duplicates of this item; it can only store and summon the original.**
If a magic item requires attunement, the 1-hour bonding ritual also counts as the time required to attune to the item, using one of your available attunement slots.

entries.name: Arcane Infusion
entries: Your intimate knowledge of arcane-technology allows you to imbue items with minor and major magical properties. You gain the following two abilities:
****Minor Infusion****
As an action, you can touch one Tiny nonmagical object and give it one of the following magical properties of your choice:

items: The object sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.
The object emits a recorded message, up to 6 seconds long, that can be replayed when tapped.
The object continuously emits a chosen odor or a nonverbal sound (like a bell tolling).
A static visual effect appears on the object's surface, such as a picture or up to 25 words of text.

entries: The properties listed above are the most common applications of this feature, but you can create other minor, harmless sensory effects of a similar power level with the approval of your Dungeon Master. You can have a number of tinkered objects active at one time equal to your **Charisma** modifier.
****Major Infusion****
Instead of learning infusions automatically, you must decipher them from existing magic items to build a library of blueprints.

items: **Learning Magical Blueprints:** To learn a new infusion, you must first have access to a magic item that possesses the property you wish to replicate. You can perform a special 1-hour ritual where you cast the *Identify* spell on the object. When you cast *Identify* as part of this ritual, you do not need to provide the 100 gp pearl component. Instead, you fuel the spell with your own volatile energy and gain **2 Core Strains**. Upon completion of the ritual, Orion successfully deciphers and stores the "magical blueprint," and it is added to your library of known blueprints.

**Infusing an Item:** You can infuse a non-magical item with a blueprint from your current list of **stored blueprints** by performing a 1-minute ritual. Alternatively, you can perform a **Rapid Infusion**:

As an **action**, you can touch a non-magical item and choose a blueprint from your **stored blueprints**. You gain a number of **Core Strains** equal to the item's rarity (1 for Common, 2 for Uncommon, 3 for Rare, etc.), and the item is instantly infused.

You can have a number of items infused at one time equal to your **maximum Core Strain limit.** If you attempt to infuse an item beyond this limit, the oldest infusion immediately ends. The infused item is considered a magical item and functions as a magic item for any creature that uses it.

entries.name: Blueprint Library & Blueprints
entries: Your symbiotic link with Orion allows you to analyze and store the schematics for both mundane and magical items. This knowledge is organized into a two-tiered system.

items: **Learning Schematics/Blueprints:**
**Non-Magical:** You can spend 1 hour with a non-magical item (a weapon, suit of armor, shield, tool, or piece of adventuring gear) to permanently store its schematic.
**Magical:** You can perform a 1-hour ritual using *Identify* (at the cost of **2 Core Strains**) to permanently learn the "magical blueprint" of a magic item's property.

**Known Blueprints:** The collection of all schematics and blueprints you have successfully learned is known as your library. This library is permanent, and there is no limit to the number of blueprints you can have in it.

**Stored Blueprints:** After you finish a long rest, you can choose a number of blueprints from your library to load into Orion's quick-access memory. The number of blueprints for both Magical and Non-Magical items that you can store is determined by your Proficiency Bonus. You can change your list of stored blueprints whenever you finish a long rest.

features.name: The Infernal Core
entries: Your bond with the suit overwrites your natural magical physiology. You lose the **Spellcasting** and **Font of Magic** features normally granted by the Sorcerer class. Instead, you gain the **Infernal Core**, which dictates how you generate and control infernal energy.

items: **Strain Limit:** Your safe operating limit is equal to your **Constitution Modifier \+ Proficiency Bonus**.

entries.name: Coolant Reserves
entries: Your raw magical potential is converted entirely into a volatile resource called **Sorcery Points (SP)**, which function as your system's **Coolant**.

items: **Capacity:** Your maximum Sorcery Point pool is calculated by converting what would be your daily Spell Slots into points, and adding your Sorcerer Level to the total.
*Conversion:* 1st=2, 2nd=3, 3rd=5, 4th=6, 5th=7, 6th=9, 7th=10, 8th=11, 9th=13.
**Restoration:** You regain all spent Sorcery Points when you finish a Long Rest. You cannot regain SP by any other means (no Flexible Casting).

entries.name: Volatile Accumulation
entries: If you push the engine beyond its limits, you risk a catastrophic meltdown.

items: **Trigger:** If you end your turn with **Core Strain** greater than your **Strain Limit**, you trigger an **Overload**.
You take **Force damage** equal to your **Current Strain**. This damage ignores resistance and immunity.

**Coolant Flush (Reaction):** When you would take damage from an Overload, you can spend **1 Sorcery Point** to reduce that specific instance of damage to **0**. This does not require an action and can only be performed when you take Overload damage.

entries.name: Overload Burst
entries: As a bonus action, you can release the volatile energy of your Infernal Core. This ability has two different effects depending on your current Core Strain level.
****Safety Vent (At Maximum Strain)****

items: **Trigger:** You can use this ability when your Core Strain is **equal to** your maximum limit.

**Effect:** You release a controlled burst of energy in a **30-foot cone** originating from you. Each creature in the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw against your  Spell Save DC. A creature takes **fire damage equal to 1d4 per point of Core Strain** on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
**Consequence:** There is **no Volatile Backlash**. Your Core Strain immediately drops to 0\.

entries: ****True Overload (Above Maximum Strain)****

items: **Trigger:** You can use this ability when your Core Strain is **at least 1 point above** your maximum limit.

**Effect:** You unleash an uncontrolled, devastating blast of energy in a **line 120 feet long and 5 feet wide** originating from you. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw against your  Spell Save DC. A creature takes **fire damage equal to 1d8 per point of Core Strain** on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
**Consequence (Volatile Backlash):** After the blast, you must make a Constitution saving throw against your own  Spell Save DC.
**On a success:** You take **half** of the total damage dealt by the burst.
**On a failure:** You take the **full** damage dealt by the burst.
If this ability was used after being primed by your `Indomitable` feature, you automatically fail this saving throw.
**Your Core Strain immediately drops to 0 after using this ability.**

entries: ****Maximum Overload (Unstable Overload State)****

items: If you use your **True Overload** feature while in an **Unstable Overload** state, you unleash the full, unfiltered energy of the critical overload. The damage type becomes Force and it ignores resistances. Damage calculation for the blast is calculated in two parts which are added together:

entries: 1. **Blast Damage:** You roll **1d8** for each point of your current total Core Strain.
2. **Withheld Damage:** You add the damage that was withheld from the **Indomitable** surge. This is **1d10** for each point of Core Strain you gained when the **Indomitable** feature was triggered.

items: **Core Meltdown:** The 120-foot line of the blast tears a scar in reality, creating a permanent zone of volatile energy. This area is now a **10-foot wide, 120-foot long** zone with the following properties:
The area is **difficult terrain**.
A creature takes **2d6 Force damage** when it **enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there**.

Any creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a **Wisdom saving throw** against your  Spell Save DC or become **frightened** until the end of its next turn.
Your mastery over Orions systems allows you to maintain a single, reconfigurable spell schematic. You designate one of your  "spells known" as your **Adaptive Spell**.

As an **Action**, you can **spend a number of Core Strains equal to the new spell's level** (minimum of 1, maximum of 3\) to temporarily reconfigure the module. Choose another spell from the  **spell list**, which must be of a level for which you have Pact Magic spell slots. Your Adaptive Spell is then replaced with the chosen spell.

The reconfigured module is unstable. The first time you cast the new spell, it is cast as normal. **Immediately after the spell is cast, the module reverts, and your Adaptive Spell returns to the original spell you chose.**

When you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to have the suit intercept. You gain **1 Core Strain**, and your Armor Class increases by an amount equal to your Constitution modifier against the triggering attack, potentially causing it to miss.
If the attack still hits, you can gain **another Core Strain** (2 Core Strains Total) to **reduce the damage you take from that attack by an amount equal to your  level \+ your Charisma modifier**.
You can channel the raw energy of the Infernal Core to cast spells you know without expending a spell slot. When you cast a spell, you can choose to use this feature.
To cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you do not expend a slot. Instead, you generate **Core Strain**:
**Cost:** You gain **Core Strain** equal to the **Level of the spell** you cast.
**Metamagic:** If you apply Metamagic, you gain additional **Core Strain** equal to the **Sorcery Point cost** of that Metamagic.

**Indomitable:** If damage reduces you to 0 hit points but does not kill you outright, you instead drop to **1 hit point**. If you are in `Autonomous Mode` when this feature activates, you **immediately enter `Integrated Mode`**.

Immediately upon activation, Orion's core goes critical and you **double the current number of core strains you have**. The overload damage you would normally take from this surge is **withheld and contained** by the suit's emergency systems, placing you in an **Unstable Overload** state.
If the **current number** of core strains after this ability triggers is **below** your core strain limit, **then you would not go into Unstable Overload state.**
**This state ends if your Core Strain drops below or equal to your maximum limit for any reason.**
Once this protocol activates, it cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

features.name: Pact of the Chassis
entries: This feature replaces the standard Pact Boon options and reflects the symbiotic nature of Leo and Orion.

items: As a bonus action, you can have Orion manifest a perfect copy of any weapon for which it has a stored schematic. This manifested weapon appears in your hand, is your pact weapon, and uses your Charisma modifier for its attack and damage rolls. It disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or if you manifest a different weapon.

entries.name: Autonomous Mode:

items: As a bonus action, you can separate from your suit. At the start of each of your turns while in this mode, you take **1d4 psychic damage** as your consciousness strains to maintain the tether.
While in Autonomous Mode, you are two separate bodies on the battlefield, but you remain mentally linked. The following rules apply:

entries: ****Shared Being:****

items: The streamlined Orion Chassis is considered an **object**, not a creature. It has an Armor Class equal to your own. Any damage the chassis takes is taken by you from your own hit point pool. If the chassis is forced to make a saving throw, it uses your saving throw bonuses.

**Tether Fail-Safe**: If the Orion chassis is ever more than 60 feet away from you at any point in time, the tether's fail-safe protocol is automatically triggered. The suit is instantly recalled to your space, and you immediately enter Integrated Mode. This also happens when Leo is incapacitated.

entries: ****Remote Action:****

items: You can act from either your own position or the chassis's position on the battlefield. When you take the Attack action or cast a spell, you can determine if it originates from your space or the chassis's space. You can also command the chassis to move up to 30 feet (no cost).
To compensate for this risk, your abilities in this mode are enhanced:

entries: ****Coordinated Casting**:**
While in Autonomous Mode, you can leverage Orion's independent processing to double your magical output.

items: **The Command:** As a **Bonus Action**, you can command Orion to cast a spell you know.
**The Cost:** You generate **Core Strain** equal to the **level at which the spell is cast**.
**Outside of combat**, you can use Autonomous Mode freely for exploration, utility, and roleplaying as if Orion is a separate creature.

entries.name: Integrated Mode:

items: As a bonus action, you can integrate with your suit. While integrated, you gain the following benefits:
**Enhanced AC:** Your Armor Class is calculated as your original Armor Class \+ your Constitution modifier \+ your Charisma modifier.
**Weapon Manifestation:** You can use your bonus action to manifest your pact weapon.

entries: ****System Override:****

items: When you cast a  spell using your action, you can choose to do one of the following:

**Offensive Override (Cost: 1 Core Strain):** Choose a damage type to which the primary target of your spell has **resistance**. Until the start of your next turn, the target loses that resistance. If the target has immunity to the chosen damage type, it is instead treated as having resistance to it for the duration.

**Defensive Override (Cost: 1 Core Strain):** You channel the spell's residual energy into a specialized defensive field. **Choose one damage type** (such as slashing, fire, or poison). You gain **resistance to that damage type until the end of your next turn**.

features.name: Optimized System
entries: *Your constant use of the suit has optimized its core functions, making both of your operational modes more efficient. You gain the following benefits:*

entries.name: While in Autonomous Mode,

items: the psychic damage you take from the Psychic Tether at the start of your turn is reduced by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries: ****Remote Dexterity:****

items: The maximum range of your psychic tether increases to 120 feet, and the chassis can use any of your tool proficiencies remotely.

entries: ****Targeting Matrix:****

items: Your psychic link to the chassis acts as a perfect targeting solution. While in Autonomous Mode, you **double the range** of any spell that originates from the chassis's space or you, and your  spells **ignore half cover and three-quarters cover**.

entries.name: While in Integrated Mode,

items: you can choose to activate your suit's Domain Protocol at the start of your turn (no action required). While this protocol is active, you gain **1 Core Strain** at the start of each of your turns, but you gain the following two benefits:

entries: ****Singularity Field:****

items: You project a field of localized gravitational distortion. Your movement speed cannot be reduced, and the area within a **10-foot radius** of you is **difficult terrain for your enemies**. When a hostile creature is moved out of the field (willingly or forced), it must succeed on a **Strength saving throw** against your  Spell Save DC or its **speed becomes 0** until the end of the turn. A creature can only be affected by this saving throw once per turn.

entries: ****Threat Matrix:****

items: At the start of each of your turns, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to **(your proficiency bonus  the number of hostile creatures in your Stabilizer Field) \+ your  Level**.

features.name: Binary Partition
entries: Your neural architecture has evolved to support multi-threaded arcane processing. You can fracture the Gemini Protocol's consciousness to maximize output, either by splitting your physical form or by overclocking your single frame.
**1\. Parallel Processing (The Action)**
When you use your Action to cast a spell, you can cast a second spell as part of the same Action.

items: **Cost:** You generate full **Core Strain** for both spells. If the second spell is a cantrip, you generate **one core strain** instead.

entries: **2\. Mode Protocols**
The physical manifestation of this processing depends on your current state:

items: **Protocol A: Autonomous Mode (The Fractal)**
**Effect:** Orion separates into **two identical constructs** (Alpha and Beta).
**Benefit:** You have three distinct points of origin for your spells (Leo, Alpha, Beta).
**The Price:** You share a single hit point pool across three bodies.
**Protocol B: Integrated Mode (The Juggernaut)**
**Effect:** The two AIs fuse within your single frameone focusing on casting, the other on stabilizing the reactor.
**Benefit:** When you use Parallel Processing in this mode, you gain **Resistance to all damage** until the start of your next turn.

**The Synergy:** This Resistance applies to the self-inflicted **Overload damage** you might take from casting the two spells. This makes Integrated Mode the "Safe" way to go Nova, allowing you to tank your own heat.

properties.Infusable Items: A cloak, suit of armor, or shield.
properties.Effect: An item infused with this blueprint gains the following property: While wearing or holding this item, a creature can use its **action** to become **invisible**. The invisibility ends if the creature makes an attack, casts a spell, or uses a bonus action to end the effect.

blueprints.name: Spatial Compression Matrix
entries: **Effect**
A container infused with this blueprint has its interior space expanded into an extradimensional pocket.

items: The container can hold up to **80 pounds**, not exceeding a volume of **64 cubic feet**.
The container's own weight becomes **0.04 pounds**, regardless of its content.
Retrieving an item from the container requires an action.
The blueprint also confers the standard risks of extradimensional storage (destruction if overloaded, pierced, or placed within another similar item.

properties.Infusable Items: A pouch, backpack, satchel, or a compartment on a suit of armor.

blueprints.name: Schematic: Tower Shield
entries: **Properties**
When you manifest this item, it has the following properties:

properties.Armor Class: When wielded by a creature proficient with shields, this massive shield provides a **\+3 bonus to AC**.
properties.Cover: When not wielded and planted on the ground as an object, the shield is large enough to provide **half cover**.
properties.Strength Requirement: Wielding this shield effectively requires a Strength score of at least 13\.
